misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No conceptual misunderstanding detected (straight-line conditional accumulation)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes they must read exactly five integers into five variables and then conditionally add each one to an accumulator if it is even.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no gap here: Java will read five integers, evaluate each %2 test, and accumulate correctly. While a loop/array would be more scalable, the problem only requires 5 integers, so the straight-line approach is logically correct.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces correct output for any 5 integers that can be read by Scanner.nextInt().
